artifact_providers.name: text
artifact_providers.description: Loads artifacts from a single file or a flat directory and keeps the file name as identifier.

path.description: Absolute or relative path to a text file or directory.

artifact_type.description: Classifies the artifact (converted to lowercase text in runtime).

artifact_providers.name: recursive_text
artifact_providers.description: Recursively walks a directory tree, preserves relative paths as identifiers, and filters by file extension.

artifact_type.description: Classifies the artifact (converted to lowercase text in runtime).

preprocessors.name: sentence
preprocessors.description: Splits documentation into sentences (artifact granularity 0, sentence granularity 1).

preprocessors.name: code_chunking
preprocessors.description: Splits source code into overlapping chunks using RecursiveSplitter with language specific separators.

language.description: Comma separated list; file extension decides which entry to use if more than one is provided.

chunk_size.description: Target number of tokens/characters per chunk.

preprocessors.name: code_method
preprocessors.description: Uses Tree-Sitter to extract Java classes (granularity 1) and methods (granularity 2).

language.description: Future proof: factory expects comma free enum literal.

preprocessors.name: code_tree
preprocessors.description: Creates package (granularity 0) ➜ class (granularity 1) hierarchies for code bases.

language.description: Currently only Java packages are supported.

compare_classes.description: Whether class level elements should be marked as comparable.

preprocessors.name: model_uml
preprocessors.description: Parses UML XMI files and emits elements for components/interfaces with optional usages/operations data.

includeOperations.description: Emit operation signatures for components and interfaces.

includeInterfaceRealizations.description: Include provided interfaces for each component.

preprocessors.name: summarize
preprocessors.description: Calls an LLM to summarize each artifact via a configurable prompt template.
preprocessors.naming_rule: Use 'summarize_<platform>' so ChatLanguageModelProvider resolves the backend.

template.description: Prompt skeleton passed to the LLM.

model.description: Model identifier understood by the selected platform.

preprocessors.name: artifact
preprocessors.description: Keeps each artifact as a single comparable element (granularity 0).

embedding_creators.name: openai
embedding_creators.description: Calls OpenAI's embedding endpoint with 40 parallel threads.

embedding_creators.name: openwebui
embedding_creators.description: Uses an OpenAI-compatible Open WebUI endpoint for embeddings.

model.description: Model exposed by the Open WebUI server.

embedding_creators.name: ollama
embedding_creators.description: Streams embeddings from an Ollama instance (supports optional basic auth).

model.description: Model tag to request from Ollama.

embedding_creators.name: onnx
embedding_creators.description: Loads a local ONNX + tokenizer pair and performs mean pooling on-device.

model.description: Semantic name for the model (used in logging/caching).

path_to_model.description: Absolute or relative path to the .onnx file.

path_to_tokenizer.description: Absolute or relative path to the tokenizer JSON.

embedding_creators.name: mock
embedding_creators.description: Testing helper that returns zero vectors (no args).

source_store.name: custom
source_store.description: Plain ElementStore without similarity search; required for sources.

target_store.name: cosine_similarity
target_store.description: ElementStore with cosine similarity retrieval ("custom" maps here for backwards compatibility).

max_results.description: Positive integer or the literal 'infinity' to disable capping.

modes.name: mock
modes.description: Returns cached/no-op links; useful for pipeline tests.

modes.name: simple
modes.description: Single yes/no prompt per source-target pair.
modes.naming_rule: Use 'simple_<platform>' to pick a ChatLanguageModelPlatform entry.

template.default: Question: Here are two parts of software development artifacts...

modes.name: reasoning
modes.description: Chat-style reasoning with selectable prompt templates and optional system message.
modes.naming_rule: Use 'reasoning_<platform>' to pick a ChatLanguageModelPlatform entry.

prompt.description: Either use the enum literal or its numeric index.

use_original_artifacts.description: Climb to the top-level target artifact before classification.

rules: Each inner list represents a sequential stage processed by PipelineClassifier.
Every config inside uses the same schema as single classifiers.

result_aggregators.name: any_connection
result_aggregators.description: Creates links whenever any element pair at the configured granularities is classified as related.

source_granularity.description: Which source granularity level should appear in the trace output.

target_granularity.description: Which target granularity level should appear in the trace output.

tracelink_postprocessors.name: req2code
tracelink_postprocessors.description: Keeps requirement IDs left, source code IDs right; no transformation beyond format normalization.

tracelink_postprocessors.name: sad2code
tracelink_postprocessors.description: Software Architecture Documentation ➜ code identifier shaping.

tracelink_postprocessors.name: sad2sam
tracelink_postprocessors.description: Software Architecture Documentation ➜ Software Architecture Model IDs.

tracelink_postprocessors.name: sam2sad
tracelink_postprocessors.description: Software Architecture Model ➜ Software Architecture Documentation IDs.

tracelink_postprocessors.name: req2req
tracelink_postprocessors.description: Strips file extensions from both ends of requirement trace links.

tracelink_postprocessors.name: identity
tracelink_postprocessors.description: No changes; use when downstream tooling expects untouched IDs.

path.description: CSV with reference trace links (format depends on dataset).

hasHeader.description: "true" or "false" (strings); required by the evaluation loader.
